intro: Angostura longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered angostura, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the leaf axils. Its fruit is a small, two-valved capsule that releases seeds when mature. Angostura longiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and understorey environments.
